name: William Shakespeare
briefDescription: English playwright, poet, and actor, widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language
notableAchievements: Created timeless characters like Hamlet, Macbeth, and Romeo and Juliet

name: Leonardo da Vinci
briefDescription: Italian polymath of the Renaissance, known for his art, science, and engineering innovations
notableAchievements: Painted the Mona Lisa and The Last Supper
Designed flying machines and other inventions

name: Marie Curie
briefDescription: Polish-French physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity
notableAchievements: First woman to win a Nobel Prize
Only person to win Nobel Prizes in two scientific fields
Discovered the elements polonium and radium

name: Mahatma Gandhi
briefDescription: Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist, and political ethicist who employed nonviolent resistance
notableAchievements: Led India to independence from British rule
Developed the philosophy of nonviolent resistance

name: Albert Einstein
briefDescription: German-born theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity
notableAchievements: Contributed to the development of quantum mechanics
Won the Nobel Prize in Physics
